#summary Explains how to build the Page Speed native shared libraries, which use a gyp-based build system similar to the one used to build Chromium.

= Prerequisites =

*Linux*
  * Install Chromium's [http://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/LinuxBuildInstructionsPrerequisites linux build prerequisites].
  * Install [http://www.chromium.org/developers/how-tos/install-gclient Chromium depot tools].

*Mac OS X*
  * An Intel Mac running Mac OS X 10.5 (“Leopard”) or 10.6 (“Snow Leopard”).  PowerPC builds are currently not supported.
  * [http://developer.apple.com/tools/xcode/ XCode] 3.1.2 or 3.1.3 (Leopard) or 3.2 (Snow Leopard). Thankfully, Apple’s build tools are free.  All you need is a free [http://connect.apple.com/ Apple Developer Connection] account.
  * Install [http://www.macports.org/install.php MacPorts]
    * After installing !MacPorts, run `sudo port install libidl`
    * If you use python25 from !MacPorts, run `sudo port install py25-socket-ssl`
  * Install [http://dev.chromium.org/developers/how-tos/install-gclient  gclient], part of the [http://dev.chromium.org/developers/how-tos/depottools depot_tools] package ([http://dev.chromium.org/developers/how-tos/install-gclient download]). gclient is a wrapper around svn that we use to manage our working copies.

*Windows*
  * Install MS Visual Studio 2005 or 2008.
  * Install [http://www.chromium.org/developers/how-tos/install-gclient Chromium depot tools].

= Check out the code =
# Create a directory to hold your source code.  It is important that the full directory path contains no spaces.

# In a shell window, execute the following commands:
  * `gclient config http://page-speed.googlecode.com/svn/firefox_addon/trunk/src`
  * `gclient update`

= Compile the code =
  * Linux
    # Run: `cd src/build; hammer --mode=Release`.
    # Build output will appear under `src/sconsbuild`.

  * Max OS X
    # Run: `cd src/build; xcodebuild -project all.xcodeproj -configuration Release -target All`
    # Build output will appear under `src/xcodebuild`.

  * Windows
    # Open src/build/All.vcproj in Visual Studio.
    # Run "Build Solution" from the "Build" menu.
    # Build output will appear under src/build/Release or src/build/Debug depending on your configuration options.
